Name: Plug and Play Food & Beverage
Justification: Stage-agnostic 12-week food innovation platform connecting startups with 500+ corporate partners. Focus areas include personalized nutrition, functional foods, protein alternatives, packaging innovation, and waste reduction. Directly relevant to all three challenges.
Best Contact: General Inquiries (investment@plugandplaytechcenter.com) Phone: (408) 524-1400
Notes: Global presence with 50+ locations. Corporate partners include Tetra Pak and DuPont Nutrition & Biosciences.

Name: IndieBio (SOSV)
Justification: World's #1 early-stage biotech accelerator supporting food biotechnology, agriculture innovation, and alternative proteins. Portfolio includes cultivated protein, functional foods, and novel processing technologies. Relevant to Challenges B and C.
Best Contact: Contact Form: https://indiebio.co/contact/
Notes: Part of SOSV ecosystem. Notable portfolio: NotCo, Upside Foods, Perfect Day. Principal & Program Director: Westley Dang (LinkedIn searchable)

Name: Techstars Farm to Fork
Justification: Partnership with Ecolab accelerating digital innovation across food and ag supply chain. Focus on sustainability, food safety, and supply chain optimization. Relevant to shelf-life technologies and packaging (Challenge A and B).
Best Contact: Brett Brohl - Managing Director (LinkedIn: linkedin.com/in/brettbrohl)
Notes: 12-week program selecting 10-12 startups annually. Also founder of The Syndicate Fund.

Name: Big Idea Ventures
Justification: Leading alternative protein investor. New Protein Fund invests $200K ($125K cash + $75K in-kind) in alternative protein and ingredients companies. Focus on functional foods, novel proteins, and food innovation. Directly relevant to Challenge C.
Best Contact: Andrew D. Ive - Founder & Managing General Partner (LinkedIn searchable) OR Media: shruti.salkar@bigideadventures.com
Notes: Twice-yearly cohorts. Backed by Bühler & Tyson. Three global locations.

Name: Yield Lab Institute
Justification: Non-profit dedicated to agrifood systems innovation. Launched H.A.R.V.E.S.T. AgTech platform in 2025 with 12 U.S. regional ecosystems + international reach (Argentina, Brazil, Israel, UK). Focus on food preservation, supply chain, packaging.
Best Contact: Stephanie Regagnon - Executive Director (LinkedIn: linkedin.com/in/stephregagnon) OR kyle@theyieldlab.com
Notes: Contact: 1100 Corporate Square Drive, Suite 212, St. Louis, MO 63132. www.harvestagtech.org

Name: Radicle Growth
Justification: AgTech/FoodTech venture capital and accelerator. Nutrien-Radicle Challenge Canada supports Canadian innovation. Focus on supply chain optimization, food waste reduction, and sustainable agriculture technologies.
Best Contact: Kirk Haney - Managing Partner (khaney@radicle.vc) OR Danielle Dougan (ddougan@radicle.vc) Phone: 978-430-9680
Notes: Partnerships with AVAC and Verdex Capital in Canada. $1.25M investment program for growth and seed-stage companies.

Name: Creative Destruction Lab (CDL) - AgriFood
Justification: Canada's premier seed-stage accelerator with dedicated AgriFood stream. Connects startups with mentors, investors, and corporate partners across the ag value chain. Focus on scalable solutions from farm to consumer.
Best Contact: Dora Tamas - AgriFood Stream Manager (dora.tamas@creativedestructionlab.com) OR CDL-Rockies: heather.marshall@creativedestructionlab.com
Notes: Multiple Canadian locations. 9-month program. Relevant to packaging innovation and food preservation technologies.

Name: MaRS Discovery District - Food & AgTech Mission
Justification: Major Toronto innovation hub with new FoodTech venture accelerator (2025). Supports 10 Canadian startups in supply chain innovation, emissions reduction, waste reduction, and efficiency. FCC partnership brings industry leaders together.
Best Contact: Tyler Hamilton - Senior Director Climate (LinkedIn searchable) OR MaRS Partnerships team through www.marsdd.com/accelerators/
Notes: Address: 101 College Street, Suite 100, Toronto, ON M5G 1L7. Coalition includes Wittington Ventures, S2G Investments, TELUS Agriculture.

Name: SKU Accelerator
Justification: Leading 12-week CPG accelerator for market-validated brands across food, beverage, pet care, and health & wellness. Focus on scaling innovative products with mentorship and retailer connections. Relevant to Challenge C (wellness products).
Best Contact: Buff Greebe - Executive Director ([email protected]) OR www.sku.is
Notes: Headquartered in Austin. Focus on women and BIPOC-owned businesses. Strong retail network for go-to-market strategy.

Name: Alchemist Accelerator
Justification: Enterprise-focused accelerator with food tech and healthcare verticals. Memphis East Coast hub adjacent to logistics, supply chain, and healthcare leaders. Supports food preservation technology and B2B food innovation.
Best Contact: Rachel Chalmers - President & Managing Director (LinkedIn searchable) Phone: (415) 527-0158
Notes: www.alchemistaccelerator.com. 6-month program. Enterprise monetization focus relevant to B2B food technology.

Name: Good Food Institute
Justification: Leading non-profit accelerating alternative protein innovation. Strategic support for startups, established companies, and meat producers. Focus on cultivated meat, plant-based proteins, and fermentation. Directly relevant to Challenge C.
Best Contact: Contact Form: gfi.org/contact OR Philanthropy team: philanthropy@gfi.org Phone: 202-596-2262
Notes: Global presence with offices in USA, India, Europe, Brazil, and Asia-Pacific. Email format: [first].[last]@gfi.org

Name: Anterra Capital
Justification: AgTech investment firm with $260M Fund II investing in biotech and digital solutions across agrifoodtech value chain. Focus on ag fintech, crop science, animal health, sustainable packaging, and functional foods.
Best Contact: Adam Anders - Managing Partner (LinkedIn searchable) OR Team page: anterracapital.com/team/
Notes: 18-person team including 4 partners. Invests in innovations addressing agricultural productivity and sustainability.

Name: Forward Fooding
Location: UK (London) with offices in Barcelona & Rome
Justification: World's first collaborative platform for F&B industry fostering innovation via FoodTech Data Intelligence. Publishes FoodTech 500 ranking. Bespoke scouting services connect corporations with relevant startups for partnerships and acquisitions.
Best Contact: Alessio D'Antino - Founder (LinkedIn searchable) OR General: info@forwardfooding.com
Notes: Offices: London (36-40 York Way, N1 9AB), Barcelona (Passeig del Mare Nostrum, 15), Rome (Via Marsala, 29H). Max Leveau - COO

Name: Cornell University - Food Venture Center
Justification: Leading food science program with Food Venture Center offering business development, product safety, technology transfer and commercialization services. Expertise in food processing, packaging innovation, and product development. Relevant to all three challenges.
Best Contact: Louise Felker - Food Venture Center (lmf226@cornell.edu) OR General: fdscigrad@cornell.edu Phone: 607-255-2539
Notes: Center for Technology Licensing handles IP commercialization. Food Venture Center locations in Geneva and NYC. IFT-recognized program.

Name: UC Davis - Innovation Institute for Food & Health
Justification: Internationally recognized food science program. IIFH drives interdisciplinary research and commercialization through strategic partnerships. CAPPS Center focuses on food processing/packaging. Edible film coatings developed here used worldwide. All challenges relevant.
Best Contact: Marissa Pickard - Innovation Institute for Food & Health (916-599-5551 | [email protected])
Notes: Partnership with Nestlé Health Science (Oct 2025). Carlos Alvarez Food Innovation Lab. CAPPS Center partners with Ohio State and NC State.

Name: University of Guelph - Ontario Agri-Food Innovation Alliance
Justification: Canada's leading food science university. World-class government-university collaboration supporting Ontario's $51B agri-food sector. Focus on commercialization, technology transfer, and innovation. $1.2M in commercialization revenue from Alliance-funded research.
Best Contact: Senior Manager Research Programs (favrinst@uoguelph.ca) Phone: 519-824-4120 Ext. 56725 OR Director (laurieha@uoguelph.ca) Ext. 56655
Notes: Alliance partners: U of G, ARIO, Ontario Ministry. Research Innovation Office handles technology transfer. Contact: www.uoguelph.ca/alliance/about/contact-us

Name: Ohio State University - Food Innovation Center
Justification: Gateway to university for industry partnerships in food innovation. Director Ken Lee won 2014 IFT Macy award for industry-academic partnerships. Focus on sustainable multi-disciplinary food solutions, packaging research through CAPPS Center.
Best Contact: Ken Lee - Food Innovation Director (LinkedIn: linkedin.com/in/ken-lee-0b035b74) OR www.fic.osu.edu
Notes: Also houses Wilbur A. Gould Food Industries Center (foodindustries.osu.edu). CAPPS Center partner with UC Davis and NC State.

Name: North Carolina State University - Food Bioprocessing & Nutrition Sciences
Justification: Houses Southeast Dairy Foods Research Center and Center for Advanced Processing and Packaging Studies (CAPPS). Strong focus on aseptic packaging, modified atmosphere packaging, active packaging, and shelf-life studies. Challenge A and B directly relevant.
Best Contact: Department Contact: General inquiries through cals.ncsu.edu/food-bioprocessing-and-nutrition-sciences/
Notes: 100+ faculty/staff, 500+ students. Multiple facilities including Schaub Hall, Howling Cow Dairy, Plants for Human Health Institute (Kannapolis).

Name: Stanford University - Office of Technology Licensing
Justification: Premier materials science program with expertise in biodegradable materials, bio-polymers, and advanced packaging. OTL handles commercialization of materials science innovations. Relevant to Challenge A (sustainable packaging).
Best Contact: General Inquiries: Contact form at otl.stanford.edu OR Materials Science Dept: msestudentservices@stanford.edu Phone: (650) 723-2534
Notes: Materials Science location: Durand Building, 496 Lomita Mall, Suite 102, Stanford, CA 94305-4034

Name: McGill University - Macdonald Campus
Justification: Leading food science program at Macdonald Campus. RITA consortium catalyzes innovation and knowledge transfer between research community and Quebec's food processing industry. Focus on food safety, processing, and product development.
Best Contact: General Macdonald Campus (info.macdonald@mcgill.ca) Tel: 514-398-7773 OR Graduate Coordinator: Erin Minnett (erin.minnett@mcgill.ca) 514-398-7560
Notes: Address: 21,111 Lakeshore, Ste Anne de Bellevue, Quebec H9X 3V9. RITA supports industry-research partnerships.

Name: Purdue University - Food Science Department
Justification: 20+ year Industrial Associates program with strong industry partnerships. Food Entrepreneurship and Manufacturing Institute (FEMI). Focus on food safety, processing technology, and product commercialization. Relevant to all challenges.
Best Contact: Jessica Weller - External Relations & Career Services (wellerj@purdue.edu) OR General: foodsci@purdue.edu Phone: (765) 494-8256
Notes: Address: 745 Agriculture Mall Drive, West Lafayette, IN 47907. Extension programs include FEMI, ServSafe, PCQI training.

Name: University of Massachusetts Amherst - Food Science
Justification: Food Science Extension Program supports development from concept to commercialization. Industrial Strategic Research Alliance partners with 30+ multinational food companies since 1995. Focus on food safety, product development, packaging.

Notes: Location: Stockbridge Hall, 80 Campus Center Way, Amherst, MA 01003-9246. Phone: (413) 545-4800

Name: University of British Columbia - Food & Beverage Innovation Centre
Justification: New Food and Beverage Innovation Centre bringing together services and technology for BC's agriculture, agri-food and seafood industry. UILO enables 1,200+ partnerships annually between industry and researchers.
Best Contact: Partnerships: partnerships@innovation.ubc.ca OR UILO for research collaboration
Notes: BC Food Hub Network member. Inventions and licensing team assesses commercial potential, develops patenting strategies, negotiates with licensees.

Name: Rutgers Food Innovation Center
Justification: Multiple locations providing product development, pilot plant services, and commercialization support. Executive Director Nolan Lewin. Deep investor network and international partnerships. Focus on food processing, product development, scaling.
Best Contact: Nolan Lewin - Executive Director (nl95@njaes.rutgers.edu) Phone: +1 (856) 391-7603 OR Dr. Thomas Hartman (hartmant@njaes.rutgers.edu) +1 (848) 932-5543
Notes: Bridgeton location: 450 East Broad Street, Bridgeton, NJ 08302. New Brunswick location at Food Science Building. Part of NJCERN.

Name: University of Wisconsin-Madison - Center for Dairy Research
Justification: World-leading product development, contract research, and food processing innovation. Pilot plant facilities available for fee-for-service. CDR partners with industry for special projects, troubleshooting, and manufacturing optimization.

Notes: Babcock Hall, 1605 Linden Dr., Madison, WI 53706. Three pilot plant facilities. Babcock Dairy Plant available for industry projects.

Name: EIT Food - Accelerator Network
Justification: Europe's leading food innovation network with Accelerator Network supporting 348+ agrifood startups since 2018. Connects startups with corporate partners (Bayer, Corteva, Unilever, Mondelēz, Mars). Equity-free support. All three challenges relevant.

Notes: Multiple European innovation hubs. 2025 cohort: 65 startups selected. Corporate pilots and market adoption support.

Name: Foodvalley NL
Justification: Non-profit agrifood innovation cluster with 215+ company network. Focus on Protein Shift, Food & Health, Circular Agrifood. Lead partner of Food Innovation Hub Europe. Bespoke scouting and partnership facilitation. Relevant to all challenges.
Best Contact: Emmanuel Anom - Lead Shared Facilities (emmanuel.anom@foodvalley.nl) OR General: facilities@foodvalley.nl
Notes: Address: Bronland 10F, 6708 WH, Wageningen. Partners with EIT Food. SME Innovation Voucher program available.

Name: StartLife
Justification: European top agrifoodtech accelerator. Growing food & agri startups into leading enterprises. Cohort-based acceleration with hands-on support. Located at Wageningen Campus alongside world's #1 food science university. All challenges relevant.
Best Contact: Jan Meiling - Managing Director (LinkedIn searchable) OR Loet Rammelsberg - Program Director (LinkedIn searchable)
Notes: Office: Plus Ultra II, Bronland 10, Wageningen Campus. Part of Wageningen ecosystem with access to research facilities.

Name: Nordic Foodtech VC
Justification: Early-stage VC fund (€42M) dedicated to food innovation across Nordics and Baltics. Invests in food production technologies including biotechnology, mobile tech. Portfolio spans Finland, Sweden, Denmark, Estonia. Relevant to all challenges.
Best Contact: General Inquiries ([email protected])
Notes: Founded 2020. 13 portfolio companies. Focus on early-stage food technology innovations. Regional expertise in Nordic/Baltic markets.

Name: KTN (Innovate UK Business Connect) - AgriFood
Justification: UK's Knowledge Transfer Network helping businesses access expertise, funding, and connections for AgriFood innovation. Experts in livestock, aquaculture, food, crops. 45+ years facilitating Knowledge Transfer Partnerships. All challenges relevant.
Best Contact: Contact Form: www.ktninnovationexchange.co.uk/contact OR AgriFood program: ktn-uk.co.uk/programmes/food-innovation-network
Notes: Address: Suite G, First Floor, The HQ, Runway Buildings, Harwell Science Campus, Didcot. Part of Innovate UK.

Name: Wageningen University & Research
Justification: World's #1 ranked university for agriculture and food science. Food & Biobased Research develops innovations for healthy foods, sustainable food chains, bio-based materials. Extensive public-private partnerships. All three challenges directly relevant.
Best Contact: Contact our experts page: www.wur.nl/en/value-creation-cooperation/partnerships-collaborations/contact-our-experts.htm
Notes: Account managers for different regions. Employee database to find specific experts. Collaborates closely with Foodvalley NL cluster.

Name: Imperial College London - Enterprise
Justification: Premier UK university with food science partnerships (Dairy Crest, Danone, Nestlé). Centre for Synthetic Biology, MRC Centre of Molecular Bacteriology. Industry Partnerships & Commercialisation team with deep commercial acumen. Challenges A and C relevant.
Best Contact: Industry Partnerships: www.imperial.ac.uk/enterprise/business/industry-partnerships-and-commercialisation/
Notes: AGRI-net facilitates translation of tools for crop sustainability. Centre for Translational Nutrition and Food Research active.

Name: ETH Zurich
Justification: Leading Swiss university emphasizing sustainability, quality, safety in food manufacturing and packaging. Future Food Initiative exploring alternatives to plastics. ETH transfer handles technology commercialization. Challenge A directly relevant.
Best Contact: ETH transfer for technology commercialization OR IFNH (Schmelzbergstrasse 9
Notes: 8092 Zürich)
column8: Department of Health Sciences and Technology. Sustainable Food Processing Lab. Strong focus on packaging innovation.

Name: University of Cambridge - Cambridge Enterprise
Justification: World-leading university with Cambridge Enterprise technology transfer office. Ceres Agri-Tech Knowledge Exchange Partnership for agri-tech commercialization. Strong food science and materials science programs. All challenges relevant.
Best Contact: Business Partnerships Team: www.cam.ac.uk/business-and-enterprise/contact-us OR Cambridge Enterprise: Hauser Forum
Notes: Ceres Agri-Tech Knowledge Exchange catalyzes early-stage technology transfer. Professional consultancy support for partnerships.

Name: Technical University Munich (TUM) - FACIT
Justification: Leading German food technology university. FACIT (Food and Agro Center for Innovation and Technology) accompanies entrepreneurial activities. TUM Venture Lab Food/Agro/Biotech. EIT Food partnership. All challenges relevant.
Best Contact: FACIT: www.tcf.tum.de/en/facit/home/ OR EIT Food partnership page
Notes: TUM School of Life Sciences Weihenstephan. FEMIB Project strengthens Bavarian AgriFoodTech ecosystem. 160+ international partnerships.

Name: University of Copenhagen - Food Science
Justification: Scandinavia's largest food research university. Tech Transfer Office handles IP commercialization. External Partnerships section matches company needs with university expertise. Strong industry collaboration track record. All challenges relevant.
Best Contact: Tech Transfer Office: +45 353-26603 OR External Partnerships: partnerships@adm.ku.dk
Notes: Address: Tagensvej 16A, 2200 København N. UCPH Lighthouse innovation hub. Legal team for Research and IP available.

Name: University College Dublin (UCD) - NovaUCD
Justification: #1 globally on citations in agricultural science and food science. NovaUCD nurtures high-tech startups. Ranked 24th worldwide in agriculture/food research. €31.5M sustainable food Co-Centre. Partnership with UC Davis. All challenges relevant.
Best Contact: Micéal Whelan - Communications Manager Innovation (miceal.whelan@ucd.ie) Phone: +353 1 716 3712
Notes: School of Agriculture and Food Science ranked 24th globally. 580-acre UCD Lyons Research Farm. Institute of Food and Health.

Name: SGInnovate
Justification: Government-owned deep tech innovation platform supporting biotech, agrifood, sustainability, and advanced manufacturing startups. Focus on early-stage deep technology companies solving global challenges. Relevant to all challenges, especially novel food technologies.
Best Contact: Contact: www.sginnovate.com/contact-us OR DTC Contact: www.sginnovate.com/dtc-contact
Notes: Corporate office: 32 Carpenter St, Singapore 059911. Deep Tech Community programs available. Active in biotech and agrifood.

Name: A*STAR Singapore Institute of Food and Biotechnology Innovation (SIFBI)
Justification: Translational research institute providing single touchpoint for industry in food, nutrition, biotechnology, food safety. Partnership programs with public and private sectors. Major collaborations with Monell, NUS, Singapore Polytechnic. All challenges relevant.

Notes: Phone: (65) 6826 6111. Address: 2 Fusionopolis Way, Innovis #08-01, Singapore 138634. Hours: M-F 8:30am-6pm

Name: National University of Singapore (NUS) - Food Science & Technology
Justification: Leading Asian university with 17 patents, 9 license agreements, 9 spin-offs in food science. Bezos Centre for Sustainable Protein ($30M grant). NUS Enterprise/TTI handles commercialization. Strong alternative protein focus. All challenges relevant.
Best Contact: Department: food@nus.edu.sg Phone: +65 6516 1656 OR NUS Enterprise/TTI for commercialization
Notes: Address: S14 Level 6 Science Drive 2, Singapore 117542. Innovation 4.0 Building, 3 Research Link #05-01 for TTI.

Name: Enterprise Singapore - FoodInnovate
Justification: Government agency leading FoodInnovate initiative positioning Singapore as Asia's food/nutrition hub. Partners with GROW accelerator, AgFunder, EDB. Supports food security strategy and global investment. All challenges relevant.
Best Contact: Website: www.enterprisesg.gov.sg OR Industry Partners page for agritech
Notes: Collaborates with Temasek, Singapore Food Agency. Organizes Asia-Pacific Agri-Food Innovation Summit. Contact through official website.

Name: Korea Food Research Institute (KFRI)
Justification: National research institute established 1965 under Ministry of Food and Drug Safety. Expertise in high-pressure processing, modified atmosphere packaging for shelf life extension. Government-funded R&D for food sector. Challenge A and B highly relevant.
Best Contact: Contact through National Research Council of Science and Technology OR Website: www.kfri.re.kr/?r=en
Notes: Active international collaborations. MOU with universities for research funding. Focus on food quality, safety, and innovative preservation methods.

Name: Hong Kong Science and Technology Parks Corporation (HKSTP)
Justification: Innovation platform focusing on Green Technology and Biomedical Technology clusters relevant to food innovation. Provides partnerships, incubation, and commercialization support. Strong regional presence. All challenges relevant.
Best Contact: Partnerships: partnerships@hkstp.org OR General: enquiry.marketing@hkstp.org Phone: +852 2629 1818
Notes: Address: 5/F, Building 5E, 5 Science Park East Avenue, Hong Kong Science Park. Also operates Hong Kong-Shenzhen Innovation Park.

Name: National Agriculture and Food Research Organization (NARO)
Justification: Japan's leading agriculture and food research organization under Ministry of Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries. Extensive international partnerships (INRAE France, CGIAR). Focus on climate adaptation, food security, robotics. All challenges relevant.
Best Contact: International Relations Office: Contact through www.naro.go.jp/english/global-initiatives/
Notes: Hosts International Symposium on Food and Health annually. MOU partnerships globally. Recent focus on fermentation technology and health.

Name: Temasek Life Sciences Laboratory (TLL)
Justification: Leading agri-food biotechnology research institute with international partnerships. Temasek Life Sciences Accelerator (TLA) commercializes innovations. Focus on improving food availability and nutrition for urban populations. All challenges relevant.
Best Contact: Research partnerships: [email protected] OR TLA commercialization: hello@tla.com.sg
Notes: Website: www.tll.org.sg. Collaborates with world-class institutes and multinationals. Decarbonising Rice Project contact: [email protected]

Name: CSIRO - Food Innovation Centre
Justification: Australia's national science agency with extensive international partnerships. CSIRO-A*STAR Innovation in Food for Sustainability Program. Global collaborations (India, Japan, US, UK, Vietnam). All challenges relevant, especially sustainability.
Best Contact: IF4S Program: IF4S@csiro.au OR General: Phone 1300 363 400 / +61 3 9545 2176
Notes: Website: research.csiro.au/food-innovation/. Works with manufacturers globally on innovation, technology support. Strong international presence.

Name: Seoul National University - Food Science and Biotechnology
Justification: Top Korean university with Department of Agricultural Biotechnology including Food Science program. Research in AI technology, material standardization, biotechnology for phytoceuticals, food microbiome. All challenges relevant.
Best Contact: Department: +82-2-880-4850 OR +82-2-873-5095 OR Website: food.snu.ac.kr/en/
Notes: Research on high value-added biomaterials, enzyme technology, food microbiology. Contact technology transfer office for commercialization.

Name: Institut Agro
Justification: French scientific establishment under Ministry of Agriculture. 4,500 students, 300 teacher-researchers, 39 research units, 187 international partnerships. AgroValoMéditerranée business incubation site. Member of Euroleague for Life Sciences. All challenges relevant.
Best Contact: Contact: contact@supagro.fr Phone: +33 (0)4 99 61 22 00
Notes: Address: 2 place Pierre Viala, 34060 Montpellier. Six campuses. ECOTROPHELIA student food innovation contest. Partners with INRAE.

Name: INRAE (National Research Institute for Agriculture Food and Environment)
Justification: France's leading agriculture, food and environment research institute. 450+ socio-economic partners, 15 high innovation potential fields, 4 Carnot Institutes. Extensive international partnerships (FAO, WHO, CGIAR, FAPESP). All challenges relevant.
Best Contact: Collaboration: www.inrae.fr/en/collaborate OR International: www.inrae.fr/en/international
Notes: Regional contact example: philippe.hinsinger@inrae.fr. LIAs (international associated laboratories) for joint projects. Partnership Officers available.

Name: Future Food Institute
Justification: Italian social enterprise with global horizons. Living Labs in Italy, US, Japan. Affiliate centers in China, Singapore, Germany. Future Food Accelerator facilitates open innovation between startups, business, global food ecosystem. All challenges relevant.
Best Contact: General: info@futurefoodinstitute.org Phone: +39 051 656 9619 OR Pollica office: +39 3336417696
Notes: Address: Piazza Giuseppe Verdi, 2, 40126 Bologna. Prosperity-driven alliances with government and industry. Sustainable food systems focus.

Name: Station F - ShakeUp Factory
Justification: World's largest startup facility. ShakeUp Factory is exclusive food acceleration program at Station F. Oversees French hub of EIT Food. Innovation hub combining accelerator, open-innovation, experts network. All challenges relevant.
Best Contact: Contact through: stationf.co OR ShakeUp Factory: shakeupfactory.co/startups
Notes: 1,000+ startups. Partners: Google, LVMH, Meta, HEC. 13th arrondissement Paris. ShakeUp Factory partners with Bridge2Food.

Name: Fraunhofer IVV (Institute for Process Engineering and Packaging)
Justification: Leading R&D for high-quality food and packaging. Focus on food technology, recycling, environment. CIRCULAR FoodPack coordinator. 13 Fraunhofer institutes in food alliance. Challenge A (packaging) highly relevant.

Name: University College Cork (UCC)
Justification: Top Irish university for industry collaboration (Knowledge Transfer Ireland). School of Food and Nutritional Sciences recognized for research in food packaging, ingredients, supply chain. UCC Innovation Office handles commercialization. All challenges relevant.

Notes: Western Gateway Building, Western Road, Cork T12 XF62. Research Office: uccresearch@ucc.ie +353 (0)21 4903500. Strong food business programs.

Name: DTU National Food Institute
Justification: 335 staff across five departments. Scientific advice to Danish authorities and international organizations. Close collaboration with Danish and international food companies. Strong technology transfer capability. All challenges relevant.

Notes: Address: Mørkhøj Bygade 19, DK 2860 Søborg. Head of Studies contact: Marianne Uhre Jakobsen. www.food.dtu.dk

Name: Aarhus University - Department of Food Science
Justification: Top 100 university with extensive business collaborations. Centre for Innovative Food Research (iFOOD). EIT Food partner. Four strategic themes: Plant/food/environment, Climate friendly foods, Circularity, Food/health. All challenges relevant.

Notes: Address: Kirstinebjergvej 10, DK-5792 Aarslev. Website: food.au.dk. Strong focus on dissemination and implementation for industry.

Name: Vinnova (Sweden's Innovation Agency)
Justification: Government agency enhancing Sweden's competitive edge and innovation capacity. Innovation platforms for sustainable food systems. Funding opportunities and collaboration platforms for green transition in food sector. All challenges relevant.
Best Contact: Contact through: www.vinnova.se/en/
Notes: Eight innovation platforms for sustainable food systems. Creates conditions to increase pace of food transition. Sweden Foodtech ecosystem support.
